TFSettingsWidget

class ui.tf_widgets.tf_settings_widget.TFIconButton(parent, icon_path: str, position: Tuple[int, int], on_click: Callable | None, size: Tuple[int, int] | None = None)[source]

Bases: QPushButton

A base class for icon-based buttons with fixed size and position.

Parameters:

  • parent (QWidget) – Parent widget.

  • icon_path (str) – Path to the icon image.

  • position (Tuple[int, int]) – Button position (x, y).

  • on_click (Optional[Callable]) – Callback function for click event.

  • size (Optional[Tuple[int, int]], optional) – Button size (width, height). Defaults to ICON_BUTTON_SIZE (20, 20).

__init__(parent, icon_path: str, position: Tuple[int, int], on_click: Callable | None, size: Tuple[int, int] | None = None)[source]
class ui.tf_widgets.tf_settings_widget.TFCloseButton(parent, position: Tuple[int, int] = None)[source]

Bases: TFIconButton

A specialized button for closing windows or panels.

Parameters:

  • parent (QWidget) – Parent widget to be closed.

  • position (Tuple[int, int], optional) – Button position (x, y).

Example

>>> close_btn = TFCloseButton(
...     parent=window,
...     position=(380, 5)
... )
__init__(parent, position: Tuple[int, int] = None)[source]
on_click()[source]
class ui.tf_widgets.tf_settings_widget.MenuSection(value, names=<not given>, *values, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration of menu sections for organizing actions.

Variables:

  • WINDOW_CONTROL – Section for window positioning controls.

  • CUSTOM – Section for custom user-added actions.

  • WINDOW_MANAGEMENT – Section for window management actions like close.

WINDOW_CONTROL = 1
CUSTOM = 2
WINDOW_MANAGEMENT = 3
class ui.tf_widgets.tf_settings_widget.TFMenuButton(parent, position: Tuple[int, int] = None)[source]

Bases: TFIconButton

A button that displays a configurable menu when clicked.

Provides a hierarchical menu system with sections for window control, custom actions, and window management.

Parameters:

  • parent (QWidget) – Parent widget.

  • position (Tuple[int, int], optional) – Button position (x, y).

Example

>>> menu_btn = TFMenuButton(parent=window, position=(355, 5))
>>> menu_btn.add_action(
...     text="Custom Action",
...     callback=lambda: print("Custom action"),
...     section=MenuSection.CUSTOM
... )
Variables:

actions (Dict[MenuSection, List[QAction]]) – Actions organized by menu section.

__init__(parent, position: Tuple[int, int] = None)[source]
on_click()[source]
init_default_actions()[source]
add_action(text: str, callback: Callable, section: MenuSection = MenuSection.CUSTOM, index: int = -1)[source]

Add a new action to the menu.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – Action text label.

  • callback (Callable) – Function to call when action triggered.

  • section (MenuSection, optional) – Menu section. Defaults to CUSTOM.

  • index (int, optional) – Position in section. Defaults to -1 (append).

remove_action(text: str, section: MenuSection | None = None)[source]

Remove an action from the menu.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – Text of action to remove.

  • section (Optional[MenuSection], optional) – Section to search in. If None, searches all sections.

clear_section(section: MenuSection)[source]

Remove all actions from a specific section.

Parameters:

section (MenuSection) – Section to clear.

move_action(text: str, new_section: MenuSection, new_index: int = -1)[source]

Move an action to a different section.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – Text of action to move.

  • new_section (MenuSection) – Destination section.

  • new_index (int, optional) – Position in new section. Defaults to -1 (append).

rebuild_menu()[source]

Rebuild the menu structure with current actions.

Clears and reconstructs menu with actions in proper sections, separated by dividers where appropriate.

on_closed_click()[source]
